Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "The Giver" and "Voyager". 

"The Giver" is a science fiction novel by Michael Crichton published in 1962. In the year 1984, the dystopian society of Oceania experiences an ideological shift when a new ruler takes control. The protagonist of the book, Jonas, is one of the few citizens who have resisted being reprogrammed to conform with the new order. The book explores themes such as individuality, morality, and the nature of reality.

"Voyager" is a science fiction novel by Jim Hall published in 1982. In the year 2042, the dystopian society of New Earth experiences an ideological shift when a new ruler takes control. The protagonist of the book, Voyager, is one of the few citizens who have resisted being reprogrammed to conform with the new order. The book explores themes such as individuality, morality, and the nature of reality.

"Tombstone" is a 1993 American western film directed by George Miller and starring Tom Hardy, Michael Biehn, and Kaley Cuoco. In the year 1874, the small town of Tombstone, Arizona, experiences an era of violence when a group of gunfighters from nearby settlements gather in town to settle scores with one another. Among the gunfighters who gather in town is Tom Hardy, a young man from a neighboring settlement who has become known among the local residents as the "Brave Stranger" or simply "The Stranger".
